meta.title: DAO Features & Information | CreateDAO
meta.description: Learn about the features and components of DAOs created with CreateDAO

header.title: DAO Features & Information
header.subtitle: Understand the components, features, and technical details of your DAO

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: CreateDAO deploys a complete DAO ecosystem with four core smart contracts that work together to provide governance, token management, treasury control, and staking capabilities.

whatYouGet.title: What You Get
whatYouGet.description: When you create a DAO through CreateDAO, you receive a complete governance system with:
items: A fully-functional DAO Core contract with proposal and voting systems
An ERC20 Governance Token with customizable tax mechanisms
A secure Treasury to manage your DAO's assets
A Staking System with time-based voting power multipliers
All contracts deployed as upgradeable proxies for future improvements

forCreators.title: For DAO Creators
items: 1 governance token to start participating
Ability to create initial proposals
Control over the initial deployment
Tools to bootstrap your community

forMembers.title: For DAO Members
forMembers.description: Your community members will be able to:
items: Stake tokens to gain voting power
Create and vote on proposals
Participate in presales
Help govern the DAO's treasury and future

architecture.title: DAO Architecture
architecture.description: Your DAO consists of four main contracts that work together to provide a complete governance system.

diagram.note: All contracts are deployed as upgradeable proxies with the latest implementations

upgradeableDesign.title: Upgradeable Design
upgradeableDesign.description: All contracts use the UUPS (Universal Upgradeable Proxy Standard) pattern, allowing for future improvements while preserving state and balances. Upgrades can only be executed through governance proposals that have passed community voting.

contractInteractions.title: Contract Interactions
contractInteractions.description: The DAO Core contract is the central hub that coordinates all governance actions. It interacts with the Token, Treasury, and Staking contracts to execute proposals approved by the community.

components.title: Core Components
components.description: Each contract in your DAO ecosystem serves a specific purpose and has unique features.

daoCore.title: DAO Core
daoCore.description: The DAO Core contract is the central governance hub that manages proposals, voting, and execution of community decisions.

features.title: Key Features:
items: Proposal System: Create, vote on, and execute various types of proposals
Voting Mechanism: Secure voting with stake-based voting power
Execution Logic: Safe execution of approved proposals
Emergency Controls: Pause/unpause functionality for security

daoToken.title: DAO Token
daoToken.description: The DAO Token is an ERC20 token that serves as the governance token for your DAO. It includes additional features beyond a standard ERC20 token.

features.title: Key Features:
items: Initial Distribution: 1 token to creator, rest to treasury
Tax Mechanism: Configurable tax rate up to 10%
Whitelisting: Addresses can be exempted from tax
Staking Integration: Works with the staking contract for governance

treasury.title: Treasury
treasury.description: The Treasury contract securely holds and manages all assets owned by the DAO, including tokens and ETH.

features.title: Key Features:
items: Asset Control: Holds majority of tokens initially
Multi-Asset: Can hold ETH and any ERC20 tokens
Governance-Controlled: Only DAO can authorize transfers
Balance Tracking: Methods to check current balances

staking.title: Staking
staking.description: The Staking contract allows token holders to stake their tokens to gain voting power in the DAO.

features.title: Key Features:
items: Time-Based Multipliers: Longer staking periods increase voting power
Voting Power Calculation: Stake Ã— Time Multiplier
Flexible Staking: Users can stake and unstake at any time
Configurable Parameters: Multipliers and thresholds can be adjusted through governance

governance.title: Governance Features
governance.description: Your DAO includes a comprehensive governance system with various proposal types and voting mechanisms.

treasuryTransfers.title: Treasury Transfers
treasuryTransfers.description: Propose to transfer tokens or ETH from the treasury to any address

presaleCreation.title: Presale Creation
presaleCreation.description: Launch token presales with customizable token amount and initial price

presaleManagement.title: Presale Management
presaleManagement.description: Pause/unpause presales and withdraw funds from completed presales

contractUpgrades.title: Contract Upgrades
contractUpgrades.description: Upgrade core contracts or modules to newer implementations

emergencyControls.title: Emergency Controls
emergencyControls.description: Pause/unpause the entire DAO in case of emergencies

moduleUpgrades.title: Module Upgrades
moduleUpgrades.description: Add or upgrade specific modules like presale or vesting contracts

votingProcess.title: Voting Process
steps: Proposal Creation: Any member with at least 1 staked token can create a proposal
Voting Period: Members have a set time period to cast their votes
Vote Casting: Members vote "For" or "Against" with their voting power
Quorum Check: At least 50% of total voting power must participate
Execution: If approved, the proposal can be executed to implement the changes

deployment.title: Deployment Process
deployment.description: When you create a DAO, the following steps happen automatically in a single transaction.
steps: Token Deployment: Your ERC20 governance token is deployed first
Treasury Deployment: Treasury contract is deployed (uninitialized)
Staking Deployment: Staking contract is deployed and linked to your token
DAO Deployment: Main DAO contract is deployed and connected to all other contracts
Treasury Initialization: Treasury is initialized with the DAO as owner
Token Configuration: Staking contract is set in token and ownership transferred to DAO
Token Distribution: Remaining tokens are transferred to treasury
Ownership Transfer: DAO becomes self-governing (owns itself)

note.title: Important Note
note.description: After deployment, your DAO is fully autonomous and controlled by governance. The creator receives 1 token to start participating, but has no special privileges beyond that. All major decisions must go through the governance process.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: After creating your DAO, here are some steps to get started with governance.

steps.title: Stake Your Token
steps.description: Stake your initial token to gain voting power. The longer you stake, the more voting power you'll have.

steps.title: Create a Proposal
steps.description: Create your first proposal to distribute tokens from the treasury or launch a presale to grow your community.

steps.title: Grow Your Community
steps.description: Invite members to join your DAO, distribute tokens through proposals, and build a decentralized community.
